article: Every weekday I show up at school at about seven in the morning. Each time I see a mostly empty parking place, I hate that I have to park in the _ . At first, I am excited to see that I can get a front row spot until I realize that I am not yet a _ . For high school students, senior year is probably the only time when someone can be dressed in _ clothes instead of uniform, and given priority for _ time in school canteen. Even some of them can shout at juniors and it doesn't seem _ . However, the more I think about it, the more _ . I think of why we should not have the fixed senior parking area. Firstly, there is only one specific area under the light poles to which senior parking signs are _ . As a result, it is difficult for one to _ how far back they must park. The whole thing seems too much of an inconvenience 44 rather than a convenience. Secondly, it does not seem _ for those who get to school early. They could have a 46 _ near the front but instead they must park near the back. It is even less _ when it is raining or snowing and students who show up to school early must walk further across the parking lot because they are not a senior. Lastly, no matter how hard the school tries to _ senior parking, there will always be those freshmen who _ to park in the senior parking spaces, regardless of the _ . Meanwhile, the school authority has hardly got a proper measure to punish those who _ the regulation. Senior parking is great if you are a senior but for the majority of the school, it is _ . If seniors want to park in the front they should arrive at school _ . There are several other _ seniors can still have but senior parking should not be one of them.
